result.execSummary:
The defendant Elijah M Dotson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 5 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 5 days credit at the Day Reporting Center. Last 3 months on Electronic Monitoring if deemed appropriate. CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

Court ordered the defendant pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by 04/02/2016.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:

Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Elijah M Dotson in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Elijah M Dotson in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to negotiations,  COunt 1 dismissed and read in.  As to Count 2, Defendant pleads GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
NO REPLY FROM SURETY/DEFENDANT.

Defendant
Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Current address: 2100 W. Pierce Apt 331, Milwaukee, WI

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Must attend school.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.   Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Elijah M Dotson in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for walk in bench warrant.  Bail hearing proceeded. Arguments by counsel.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($500.00 signature bond) ad
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued and bail forfeited.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  Defendant tested positive and then left Justice Point.  Case set for bail review to address this in Branch 22 on 02/10/2015 at 1:30pm.
Court addresses Justice Point violation.  Court admonishes the defendant, but does not amend bail.

Defendant Elijah M Dotson in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests projected guilty plea date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  Case scheduled for bail review in Branch 22 on 02/02/2015 at 8:30am.

Defendant Elijah M Dotson in court with attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz.  Denis Stingl for Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 1/13/15.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
 Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Elijah M Dotson in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Elijah M Dotson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
